author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: ْ حُبِّيْ، أَيْ رَبِّ أَسْئَلُكَ بِذِكْرِكَ نَفْسَكَ وَبِثَنائِكَ ذاتَكَ بِأَنْ تَجْعَلَنا مِنَ الَّذِينَ أَقَرُّوا بِكَ وَاعْتَرَفُوا بِسُلْطانِكَ فِيْ أَيَّامِكَ، ثُمَ أَشْرِبْنا يا إِلهِي مِنْ أَصابِعِ الرَّحْمَةِ كَوْثَرَ العِنَايَةِ لِيُغْفِلَنا عَمَّا سِواكَ وَيُشْغِلَنَا بِكَ، وَإِنَّكَ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ عَلَى ما تَشَاءُ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ العَزِيزُ المُهَيْمِنُ القَيُّومُ وَالحَمْدُ
translation: I beseech Thee, by the praise wherewith Thou praisest Thyself and the glory wherewith Thou glorifiest Thine own Essence, to grant that we may be numbered among them that have recognized Thee and acknowledged Thy sovereignty in Thy days. Help us then to quaff, O my God, from the fingers of mercy the living waters of Thy loving-kindness, that we may utterly forget all else except Thee, and be occupied only with Thy Self. Powerful art Thou to do what Thou willest. No God is there beside Thee, the Mighty, the Help in Peril, the Self-Subsisting.
